required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Hamstrings Strengthening in Proffesional Athlets
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Hamstrings Strengthening in Proffesional Athlets

brief_summary.textblock: Athelts that meet the inclusion criteria will be randomized into two groups. The experimental group will receive an 8-week (3 days per week) specificl protocol based on hamstring strengthening (isometric, concentric and excentric exercises), and the control group will not receive any additional exercise. The aim of the study is to investigate the changes in hip and knee muscle strength, in the extensibility of cuadriceps, hamstrings and hip abductors, in the physical functions and in the final marks.

primary_outcome.description: the examiners assess the muscle strength using a hand-held dynamometer (model 01165) for hip and knee muscles
the examiners assess the muscle strength using a hand-held dynamometer (model 01165) for hip and knee muscles
the examiners assess the extensibility of the hip flexors, abductors and extensor muscles
the examiners assess the extensibility of the hip flexors, abductors and extensor muscles

secondary_outcome.description: the examiners assess the physical function using vertical jump test
the examiners assess the physical function using vertical jump test
the examiners assess the marks in competition
the examiners assess the marks in competition
the examiners assess the number of hamstring injuries
the examiners assess the number of hamstring injuries

arm_group.description: 8-week protocol (3 days per week) based on isometric, concentric and excentric exercisesof hamstrings
No intervention added to regular training.

intervention.description: A progressive and individualized hamstring strengthening protocol

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Professional Athlet
- 3 or more trainign days
- Previous hamstring injury but without symptoms for 3 months or >30% difference between cuadriceps and hamstrings strength (considered as a risk for hamstring injury)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Sistemic pathologies
- Any other type of musculoskeletal injuries in lower limb or lumbar spine
- To have a previous specific protocol
- To skip more than 3 training days
- General contraindications for physical activity
